page.title: 13MARLBOROUGH LOOKS OVERSEAS
page.content: Since 1982, the town of Marlborough has had a link with the village of Gunjur in the Gambia, West Africa and so far three generations have stayed in Marlborough. Since it is a link of friendship, and not one of aid, when the people of Gunjur asked for financial help in building a new classroom block for the local school, help was immediately at hand. Fund raising began in early 1985 to raise the Â£14,000 required. Noteable contributions of fund raising organisation have come from Preshute Primary School, the Wiltshire Police Constabulary, local Political parties and Britsh Rail. It is hoped that the target will be met by 1986 and preparations for visits by young people of Marlborough to Gunjur are being made.
